articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed on with operations near the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis on Monday amid an international push for a deal to halt fighting in Gaza and prevent a slide into a wider regional conflict with Iran and its proxies.
articles.title: Israel keeps up strikes in Gaza as fears of wider war grow

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk is due to interview Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on the X social media network on Monday in an event that could inject more surprises into the turbulent U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Elon Musk to interview Trump on X social media network

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin will discuss the situation in the Middle East with Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in Moscow on Tuesday, the Kremlin said late on Monday.
articles.title: Russia's Putin to talk Middle East crisis with Palestinian President Abbas, Kremlin says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander said on Monday Kyiv controlled around 1,000 square kilometers of Russia's Kursk region, his first public comments since Ukraine launched its biggest cross-border attack in almost 2-1/2 years of full-scale war.
articles.title: Ukraine says it controls 1,000 square km of Russia's Kursk region

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Wa Lone, Jorge Garcia
articles.description: As a physician specializing in addiction, Dr. Jasmeet Bains, the first Sikh American elected to the California assembly, was used to risky situations.
articles.title: Sikh activists in US, Canada face threats a year after Trudeau linked leader's killing to India

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden spoke on Monday to the leaders of France, Germany, Italy and the UK to discuss de-escalating tensions in the Middle East and a ceasefire in Gaza, the White House said.
articles.title: Biden, European allies discuss Middle East tensions, Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Costas Pitas
articles.description: The United States had no role in ousting Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who recently quit her position and fled the South Asian nation, the White House said on Monday, calling allegations of U.S. interference "simply false."
articles.title: US says it had no role in ousting of Bangladesh's Hasina

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine Navy said on Tuesday last week's actions by the Chinese air force over the disputed Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea were "coercive, aggressive and deceptive".
articles.title: Philippines calls Chinese air force actions over Scarborough Shoal 'coercive, aggressive, deceptive'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's agricultural sector must improve its capacity for disaster prevention and mitigation, Vice Premier Liu Guozhong said on Tuesday, according to the Xinhua news agency, also vowing more financial support to restore output after flooding.
articles.title: China vows financial support to restore agricultural output after floods

articles.author: Gerry Doyle
articles.description: A study released Monday using data from NASA's Mars InSight lander shows evidence of liquid water far below the surface of the fourth planet, advancing the search for life there and showing what might have happened to Mars' ancient oceans.
articles.title: Martian subsurface harbours oceans of life-giving liquid water
